bibliographic_metadata.Title: Fractal-Based Multi-Criteria Feature Selection to Enhance Predictive Capability of AI-Driven Mineral Prospectivity Mapping
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Tao Sun, Mei Feng, Wenbin Pu, Yue Liu, Fei Chen, Hongwei Zhang, Junqi Huang, Luting Mao, Zhiqiang Wang

abstract: AI-driven mineral prospectivity mapping (MPM) is a valid and increasingly accepted tool for delineating the targets of mineral exploration, but it suffers from noisy and unrepresentative input features. In this study, a set of fractal and multifractal methods were employed to excavate the underlying nonlinear mineralization-related information from geological features. Multiple feature selection criteria were applied to rank the relative importance of ore-related features and their fractal representations. The results indicate that fractal-trained AI models significantly improve predictive capability, especially for indirect predictor features that show subtle correlations with mineralization in the raw dataset.
methodology: supervised > tree-based > random forest; supervised > tree-based > decision tree (CART); supervised > tree-based > gradient boosting (GBDT); supervised > generalized linear models > logistic regression
key_points: Fractal and multifractal methods enhance the extraction of nonlinear mineralization-related information.
Feature selection criteria improve the ranking of ore-related features.
Fractal-trained AI models outperform those trained on raw datasets in predictive capability.
The study area is the Gannan ore district, known for tungsten deposits.
